arm_group.description: Women suspected of endometrial cancer planned to be treated by robotic assisted laparoscopy hysterectomy

brief_summary.textblock:
The propose of this study is to describe recovery and experience of pain and health related
      quality of life after robot-assisted laparoscopic hysterectomy for women with Endometrial
      Cancer or Atypical Complex Hyperplasia.

clinical_study.brief_title: Robot-assisted Laparoscopic Hysterectomy-RALH- Postoperative Complications, Quality of Life and Health Economics
condition: Treatment by Robotic Assisted Laparoscopy Hysterectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Women suspected of having Endometrial Cancer or having Atypical Complex hyperplasia

          -  Ability to understand and speak Danish

          -  Ability to cooperate

          -  Provision of written informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Having a benign condition after histopathology postoperatively

          -  Bing assigned to radiation or chemotherapy postoperatively

study_pop.textblock:
Women suspected of endometrial cancer and treated with robot-assisted laparoscopic
        hysterectomy at Copenhagen University Hospital, Herlev.

facility.name: Department of Anaesthesiology, Copenhagen University Hospital, Herlev

clinical_study.official_title: Robot-assisted Laparoscopic Hysterectomy-RALH- Postoperative Complications, Quality of Life and Health Economics

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anaesthesiology, Copenhagen University Hospital, Herlev

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative complications   Postoperative complications   Postoperative complications   Postoperative complications

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative pain measured by Brief Pain Inventory, baseline, 1 and 5 weeks and 4 months postoperatively
Health Related Quality of Life measured by QlQ-C30 and EN 24 (EORTC), EQ -5D, baseline, 1 and 5 weeks and 4 months postoperatively.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
